info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 3:22AM CDT until April 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE TODAY ACROSS COASTAL PORTIONS OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS WITH ELEVATED TO NEAR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE ACROSS INLAND AREAS... .Relative humidity values will drop into the single digits and teens across most of Deep South Texas this afternoon, with breezy northeast winds expected along the coast. A Red Flag Warning is in effect for the coastal counties of Kenedy, Willacy, and Cameron, including island portions. A Fire Danger Statement has been issued for the remainder of Deep South Texas. Burning of any kind should be avoided. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WINDS, DRY FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ISLAND PORTIONS OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 7 PM CDT this evening. * TIMING...10 AM to 7 PM. * WIND...Northeast 15 to 25 mph, with gusts to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...25 to 45 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at https://weather.gov/rgv/mapcolors#fire.
